Because we plan to release 8.0.0 in next week, this PR will be hold until the release done. @apache/skywalking-committers Feel free to review but don't merge this into master(8.0.0) to keep the next release agent stable.

> Because we plan to release 8.0.0 in next week, this PR will be hold until the release done. @apache/matt-committers Feel free to review but don't merge this into master(8.0.0) to keep the next release agent stable.

Seems you mention the wrong team 🤣
Yes, haha.

> @tristaZero If you like to try agent contribution, this is a good one.

log spanId after traceId?

can i try contribute this issue @wu-sheng

> And this change should be tested through the plugin test tool. Please take a look at plugin development doc and test requirement. You could open this config(default is off), and run the original failure case. This is a very important way for SkyWalking to improve how the PR works, and it is successful.


The testcase for class cache feature has been submitted.
SkyWalking's testing tools is great, but there are still some problems in getting started, and writing expectedData.yaml requires skills. 
Open the --debug option when running the plug-in test first, and then extract the data from logs/validatolr.out

The nodejs agent has its own tepo, out of ASF. Lrase check there.
The backend doesn't require OS, as an Java application. We have links for doc for quick start in the github readme and website.

> and writing expectedData.yaml requires skills.

Any test requires skills and time. And the point is, we could run them automatically and tested in future changes. In the OSS, we can't afford to run thousands of tests every time when we try to merge or release something. The great and stability you are feeling are 200+ contributors use their time to work on automatic tests.
I have to ask you to add this. This thing is required for all agent side changes. This one is not hard, you just need to copy one case from Spring(bootstrap classloader) and another from Tomcat(container classloader), open the config, active the Arthas(or some tools you feel important to test) and make sure the cases passed.  Expected data files are there, we don't require you to create cases, but you should test the things you mentioned and fixed.

>  but there are still some problems in getting started

We could talk about the issue, or you could send a pull request to fix or improve them. It was being used in the main repo for 800+ plugins tests, and repo is here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-agent-test-tool.
CC

@wu-sheng , Sir, First of all, I only configured the `SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_HOST` and `SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_PORT` in my  helm values.yml,  but not work;
```
    Environment:
      SW_ES_USER:                    elastic
      SW_ES_PASSWORD:                8bla12O3hQ7u4WJ43N2xzgB4
      JAVA_OPTS:                     -Xmx2g -Xms2g -Dmode=no-init
      SW_CLUSTER:                    kubernetes
      SW_CLUSTER_K8S_NAMESPACE:      default
      SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_HOST:  0.0.0.0
      SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_PORT:  1543
```
Furthermore, I find code in  [https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/v6.6.0/oap-server/server-bootstrap/src/main/resources/application.yml#L178](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/v6.6.0/oap-server/server-bootstrap/src/main/resources/application.yml#L178) It had been annotated by default, So I download the code and enable this like below:
```
telemetry:
  prometheus:
    host: ${SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_HOST:0.0.0.0}
    port: ${SW_TELEMETRY_PROMETHEUS_PORT:1543}
```
But no port 1543 started in my oap-server pod, I had read all doc but not find any more detail about the telemetry.
I would be greateful if you could provide some advice and detail on this function....

> What do you suggest? If we do the exact match, most likely people are hard to find the endpoint.

In my opinion,  the oap_analyzer should not ignore the numbers in the endpoint name because it is allowed. 

Just like the Elasticsearch default "standard" analyzer:
"text": "/xnv/abc_def/QW030384"  will be analyzed to tokens: xnv abe_def qw030384.

In this case, we can query the endpoint with a combination of some analyzed tokens in right order,  like /xnv OR /xnv/abc_dev OR QW030384 OR /xnv/abc_dev/QW030384 and so on

> I think this is the rule we are using `setting.put("analysis.analyzer.oap_analyzer.type", "stop")` in `StorageEsInstaller#createSetting`. I didn't write these codes, could you do a little more research about the difference? Then we could have a more reasonable choice.

We can refer to [analysis-stop-analyzer](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-stop-analyzer.html) and [analysis-standard-analyzer](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-standard-analyzer.html)  to get the difference of the "stop" and the "standard" type analyzer.

In short the "standard" type analyzer will not ignore the numbers, and in this case we can query by numbers in the endpoint name.

It's indeed a matter of choice, but I tend to choose the "standard" analyzer.  We usually query  with a complete endpoint name, it is confused that the results are not matching the numbers in the querying string.
